data.title: Gestalt Psychology
data.meta_description: 'Gestalt Psychology' published in 'Encyclopedia of the History of Psychological Theories'
data.text:
Adorno, T. W., Frenkel-Brunswik, E., Levinson, D. J., & Sanford, R. N. (1950). The authoritarian personality. New York: Harper.

Anderson, J. R., & Bower, G. H. (1974). Human associative memory (2nd revised printing). Washington, DC: Hemisphere.

Ash, M. G. (1995). Gestalt psychology in German culture 1890–1967: Holism and the quest for objectivity. New York: Cambridge University Press.

Baars, B. J. (1986). The cognitive revolution in psychology. New York: Guilford.

Baddeley, A. (1986). Working memory. Oxford: Clarendon Press.

Bender, L. (1938). A visual motor Gestalt test and its clinical use (Research Monographs of the American Orthopsychiatric Association, Vol. 3, pp. 1–176). New York: American Orthopsychiatric Association.

Berlyne, D. E. (1965). Structure and direction in thinking. New York: Wiley.

Bever, T. G., Fodor, J. A., & Garrett, M. A. (1968). A formal limitation of associationism. In T. R. Dixon & D. L. Horton (Eds.), Verbal behavior and general behavior theory (pp. 582–585). Englewood Cliffs: Prentice-Hall.

Birch, H. G. (1945). The relation of previous experience to insightful problem-solving. Journal of Comparative Psychology, 38, 367–383.

Breul, K. (Ed.) (1952). Cassell’s German and English dictionary (10th Rev. Ed.). London: Cassell.

Brunswik, E. (1929). Prinzipienfragen der Gestalttheorie. [Systematic questions of Gestalt theory]. In E. Brunswik, C. Bühler, & H. Hetzers (Eds.), Beiträge zur Problemgeschichte der Psychologie: Festschrift zu Karl Bühler’s 50 Geburtstag [Contributions to the history of problems in psychology: A festshrift for Karl Bühler’s 50th birthday] (pp. 78–149). Jena: G. Fischer.

Claparède, E. (1951). Recognition and “me-ness.” In D. Rapaport (Trans.), Organization and pathology of thought: Selected sources (pp. 58–75). New York: Columbia University Press. (Original work published 1911)

Corballis, M. C. (2004). FOXP2 and the mirror system. Trends in Cognitive Sciences, 8, 95–96.

de Waal, F. B. M. (2009). The age of empathy: Nature’s lessons for a kinder society. New York: Random House.

Duncker, K. (1945). On problem-solving. Psychological Monographs, 58(5, Whole No. 270) (Original work published 1935).

Ellis, W. D. (1938). A source book of Gestalt psychology. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul.

Festinger, L. (1957). A theory of cognitive dissonance. Stanford: Stanford University Press.

Gottschaldt, K. (1938a). Gestalt factors and repetition. In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 109–122). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1926.

Gottschaldt, K. (1938b). Gestalt factors and repetition (continued). In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 125–135). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1929.

Gregory, R. L. (1970). The intelligent eye. London: Weidenfeld & Nicolson.

Hamilton, S. W. (1852). The works of Thomas Reid, D. D (3rd ed.). Edinburgh: MacLachlan and Stewart.

Hanley, J. R., & Cohen, G. (2008). Memory for people: Faces, names and voices. In G. Cohen & M. Conway (Eds.), Memory in the real world (3rd ed., pp. 107–140). New York: Psychology Press/Taylor & Francis.

Hartmann, G. W. (1935). Gestalt psychology: A survey of facts and principles. New York: Ronald.

Holway, R. H., & Boring, E. B. (1941). Determinants of apparent visual size with distance invariant. The American Journal of Psychology, 54, 21–34.

Hunt, R. R. (1995). The subtlety of distinctiveness: What von Restorff really did. Psychonomic Bulletin & Review, 2, 105–112.

Kandel, E. R. (2006). In search of memory: The emergence of a new science of mind. New York: W. W. Norton.

Katona, G. (1940). Organizing and memorizing: Studies in the psychology of learning and teaching. New York: Columbia University Press.

Kendler, H. K., & Kendler, T. S. (1968). Mediation and conceptual behavior. In K. W. Spence (Ed.), The psychology of learning and motivation: Research and theory (Vol. 2, pp. 197–243). New York: Academic.

King, D. B., & Wertheimer, M. (2005). Max Wertheimer and Gestalt theory. New Brunswick: Transaction Publishers.

Koch, S. (1961). Behaviorism. In Encyclopaedia Brittanica (Vol. 3, pp. 326–329). Chicago: Encyclopaedia Brittanica.

Koffka, K. (1922). Perception, an introduction to the Gestalt-theorie. Psychological Bulletin, 19, 531–555.

Koffka, K. (1925). The growth of the mind (R. M. Ogden, Trans.). New York: Harcourt, Bruce (Original published 1921).

Koffka, K. (1935). Principles of Gestalt psychology. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul.

Köhler, W. (1909). Akustische Untersuchungen [Acoustic investigations]: I. Zeitschrift für Psychologie, 54, 241–289.

Köhler, W. (1910). Akustische Untersuchungen [Acoustic investigations]: II. Zeitschrift für Psychologie, 58, 59–140.

Köhler, W. (1915). Akustische Untersuchungen [Acoustic investigations]: III. Zeitschrift für Psychologie, 72, 1–192.

Köhler, W. (1923). Zur Theorie des Sukzessivvergleichs und der Zeitfehler [On the theory of successive comparisons and the time error]. Psychologische Forschung, 4, 115–175.

Köhler, W. (1925). The mentality of apes (E. Winter, Trans.). New York: Harcourt, Brace and World (Original work published 1917).

Köhler, W. (1929). Gestalt psychology. New York: Horace Liveright.

Köhler, W. (1938a). Simple structural functions in the chimpanzee and in the chicken. In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 217–227). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1918.

Köhler, W. (1938b). The place of value in a world of facts. New York: Liveright.

Köhler, W. (1938c). Physical Gestalten. In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 17–54). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1920.

Köhler, W. (1947). Gestalt psychology (Rev. ed.). New York: Liveright.

Köhler, W. (1969). The task of Gestalt psychology. Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Köhler, W., & von Restorff, H. (1937). Analyse von Vorgängen im Spurenfeld. Zur Theorie der Reproduktion. [Analysis of processes in the trace-field. Towards a theory of memory reproduction]. Psychologische Forschung, 21, 56–112.

Köhler, W., & Wallach, M. (1944). Figural after-effects: An investigation of visual processes. Proceedings of the American Philosophical Association, 88, 269–357

Lewis, M. D. (1995). Cognition-emotion feedback and the self-organization of developmental paths. Human Development, 38, 71–102.

Lipps, T. (1926). The laws of psychic relativity and Weber’s law. In K. Dunlop (Ed.), Psychological studies (K. Dunlop, Ed. & H. C. Sanborn, Trans.) (pp. 266–327). Baltimore: Williams and Wilkins (Original work published 1905).

Locke, J. (1947). An essay concerning human understanding (2nd ed.). London: J. M. Dent & Sons. Original work published 1701.

Maier, N. R. F. (1930). Reasoning in humans: I. On direction. Journal of Comparative Psychology, 10, 115–143.

Maier, N. R. F. (1931). Reasoning in humans: II. The situation of a problem and its appearance in consciousness. Journal of Comparative Psychology, 12, 181–194.

Maier, N. R. F. (1945). Reasoning in humans: III. The machines of equivalent stimuli and of reasoning. Journal of Experimental Psychology, 35, 349–360.

Malone, J. C. (1990). Theories of learning: A historical approach. Belmont: Wadsworth.

Mandler, G., & Mandler, J. (1969). The diaspora of Gestalt psychology: The Gestaltists and others. In D. Fleming & B. Bailyn (Eds.), The intellectual; migration: Europe and America 1950-1960 (pp. 371–419). Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.

Metzger, W. (2006). The laws of seeing (L. Spillmann, S. Lehar, M. Stromeyer, & M. Wertheimer, Trans.). Cambridge, MA: MIT Press (Original work published 1936).

Miller, G. A., Galanter, E., & Pribram, K. (1960). Plans and the structure of behavior. New York: Holt, Rinehart & Winston.

Müller, G. E. (1923). Komplextheorie und Gestalttheorie. Göttingen: Vanderhoek & Ruprecht.

Müller, G. E., & Schumann, F. (1889). Ueber die psychologischen Grundlagen gehobener Gewichte. [On the psychological foundations of the comparison of lifted weights]. Archiv für die gesammte Physiologie des Menschen und der Tiere, 45, 37–112.

Müller, G. E., & Schumann, F. (1893). Experimentelle Beiträge zur Untersuchung des Gedächtnisses. [Experimental contributions to the investigation of memory]. Zeitschrift für Psychologie, Ergänzungsband, 6, 81–190, 257–339.

Murray, D. J. (1995). Gestalt psychology and the cognitive revolution. London: Harvester Wheatsheaf.

Murray, D. J. (1999). Research on weight perception in the nineteenth century. In P. R. Killen & W. R. Uttal (Eds.), Fechner day 99: The end of 20th century psychophysics (pp. 37–42). Tempe: The International Society for Psychophysics.

Murray, D. J. (2005). Köhler, Wolfgang (1897–1967). In J. R. Shook (Ed.), The dictionary of modern American philosophers (Vol. 3, pp. 1343–1347). Bristol: Thoemmes.

Murray, D. J., & Bandomir, C. A. (2000). G. E. Müller (1911, 1913, 1917) on memory. Psychologie et Histoirie, 1, 208–232.

Murray, D. J., & Farahmand, B. (1998). Gestalt psychology and evolutionary psychology. In R. W. Rieber & K. Salzinger (Eds.), Psychology: Theoretical-historical perspectives (2nd ed., pp. 254–287). Washington, DC: American Psychological Association.

Newell, A., & Simon, H. A. (1970). Human problem solving. Englewood Cliffs: Prentice-Hall.

O’ Keefe, J., & Nadel, I. (1978). The hippocampus as a cognitive map. Oxford: Oxford University Press.

Paivio, A. (2007). Mind and its evolution: A dual coding theoretical approach. Mahwah: Lawrence Erlbaum.

Pavlov, I. P. (1957). Experimental psychology and other essays. New York: Philosophical Library. Original work published 1935.

Pylyshyn, Z. W. (1984). Computation and cognition: Toward a foundation for cognitive science. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.

Romanes, G. J. (1888). Mental evolution in man. London: Kegan Paul, Trench.

Rubin, E. (1921). Visuell wahrgenommene Figuren. [Visually perceived figures]. Copenhagen: Gyldensdalsde Boghandel. Original work published in Danish 1915.

Sahakian, W. S. (1975). History and systems of psychology. New York: Wiley.

Scheerer, M. (1931). Die Lehre von der Gestalt. [The doctrine of the Gestalt]. Berlin: de Gruyter.

Sherif, M. (1935). A study of some social factors in perception. Archives of Psychology, 27(187), 1–60.

Simon, H. A. (1987). The information-processing explanation of Gestalt phenomena. Computers in Human Behavior, 2, 241–255.

Sokal, M. (1984). The Gestalt psychologists in behaviorist America. The American Historical Review, 89, 1240–1263.

Spillmann, L. (1999). Gehirn und Gestalt. [Brain and Gestalt]. Psychologische Beiträge, 41, 458–493.

Tausch, R. (1954). Optische Täuschungen als artifizielle Effekte der Gestaltprozesse von Grössen – und Formkonstanz im der natürlichen Raumwahrnehmung. [Optical-illusions as artificial byproducts of the operation of the Gestalt processes of size and of form constancy in the perception of natural space]. Psychologische Forschung, 24, 299–348.

Ternus, J. (1938). The problem of phenomenal identity. In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 149–160). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1926.

Thorndike, E. L. (1898). Animal intelligence: An experimental study of the association processes in animals. Psychological Review Monograph Supplement, 2(4, Whole No. 8), 1–109.

Tolman, E. C. (1932). Purposive behavior in animals and man. New York: Appleton-Century-Crafts.

Tulving, E. (1983). Elements of episodic memory. New York: Oxford University Press.

von Ehrenfels, C. (1890). Über Gestaltqualitäten. Vierteljahrschrift für wissenschaftliche Philosophie und Soziologie, 14, 249–292.

von Ehrenfels, C. (1937). On Gestalt-qualities. Psychological Review, 44, 521–524.

von Restorff, H. (1933). Über die Wirkung von Bereichsbildung im Spurenfeld. [On the effect of the formation of group domains in the trace-field]. Psychologische Forschung, 18, 299–342.

Watson, J. B., & Rayner, R. (1920). Conditioned emotional responses. Journal of Experimental Psychology, 3, 1–14.

Wertheimer, M. (1910). Musik der Wedda. [Music of the Veddas]. Sammelbände der internationalen Musikgesellschaft [Collected papers of the International Music Society], 10, 300–309.

Wertheimer, M. (1912). Ueber das Denken der Naturvõlker: I. Zahlen und Zahlgebilde. [On the thinking of Aboriginal peoples: I. Numbers and numerical structures]. Zeitschrift für Psychologie, 60, 321–378.

Wertheimer, M. (1938a). Laws of organization in perceptual forms. In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 71–88). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1923.

Wertheimer, M. (1938b). The syllogism and productive thinking. In W. D. Ellis (Ed.), A source book of Gestalt psychology (pp. 274–282). London: Routledge & Kegan Paul. Original work published 1925.

Wertheimer, M. (1945). Productive thinking. New York: Harper.

Wertheimer, M. (1961). Experimental studies on the seeing of motion. In T. Shipley (Ed. & Trans.), Classics in psychology (pp. 1032–1089). New York: Philosophical Library (Original work published in 1913).

Wertheimer, M. (1985). A Gestalt perspective on computer simulations of cognitive processes. Computers in Human Behavior, 1, 29–33.

Westheimer, G. (1999). Gestalt memory reconfigured: Max Wertheimer’s anticipation of recent developments in visual neuroscience. Perception, 28, 5–19.

Yilmaz, H. (1967). A theory of speech perception. Bulletin of Mathematical Biophysics, 29, 793–825.
